Journal Story: Howdy everyone. Well my AT journey will start in May. I almost have all my gear, my backpack will be delivered by the end of today. I will be uploading pics of my gear and stuff.  Out for now...Cake

Howdy One and All,My backpack arrived a couple a days ago. I'm so excited, I am going to hike The Appalachian Trail. I've been collected gear for a year now and I'm ready to go in May 2016. Going to start walking a lot more now to get my legs ready. I'll keep you all updated on my progress. Bye for now.Cake
Howdy again,Wanted to add my third post so that my friends can keep track of my journey this coming spring. I'll be posting more soon. Bye for now.Cake
Destination: Third entry so I can post....

Journal Story: Hello one and all,I thought I would test my Ipad and my folding Verbatim keyboard. They work great. Got to try to keep them dry. Out for now.Cake

I am so excited. My adventure starts in 2 months and 5 days, not that I'm counting..HaHa. Going on a 3 day camp/hike next week to try out all of my gear. Just need trekking poles and shoes, then I'm good to go.I still need to write the famous "Why am I hiking The Appalachian Trail".Still figuring out all the reasons   I'll post pics and gear reviews next week. Have an awesome day everyone.Cake

Well, let see. Why am I hiking The Appalachian Trail. First things first, the adventure. I haven’t been on an adventure since I don’t know when. I am going to have the time of my life. I’ll see beautiful sunsets, and awe inspiring sun rises.I can’t wait to meet and make new friends. I’m also going to meet myself again; the younger, funnier side of me, like I used to be in my teens.I will re-learn self-reliance; how to pitch a tent quickly in the rain without getting too wet. I will also learn how to gratefully accept help from friends and trail angels.Many thanks to my wonderful husband, Jeff. He has put up with the almost non-stop talk of walking the trail for 4 years now. He has been a sweetheart for supporting me in this dream. He’ll be seeing me off at Harpers Ferry in May.Cake

This was my third time camping at Fort DeSoto Park. But, it was my first time camping without my golden retriever, Daisy. Very quiet this time. Also, this was a gear check trip. 
The Big Agnes tent is amazing. Easy to set up and take down. Practiced that many times. The first night it rained, (awesome). Tent held up fine and most important, I stayed dry.  
Brought both sleeping bags but used the warmer of the two. The temps at night were around 45-50, so I was pretty warm.
Sleeping pad was awesome. Self-inflates fast. Packs up nice and small, but I think I’ll get one of those Therm-a-Rest Z Lite Sol mattresses and use both. I know that’s extra weight (10 oz.) but I need to get a good night’s sleep. Also I am a side sleeper and need the extra padding for my boney shoulders.
My cooking set up works well, especially the wind screen. I can see why everyone recommends having one. I used alcohol as fuel and I think I’ll use it on the trail. Ate the usual foods on my three day adventure; oatmeal, potatoes, rice and noodle sides.
Did some walking…….. 
The funny thing is--- everything worked great or better than expected; except the phone charger. Not too bad.  
The count-down has begun. Only seventy-four days to go before I start my Appalachian Adventure.
Cake

Made my 9 hour round trip pilgrimage to REI in Jacksonville, Florida. The store and staff were awesome.  Cake. ??"I find I'm so excited, I can barely sit still or hold a thought in my head."            (The Shawshank Redemption)

Good morning one and all, “A dreamer named Benton MacKaye imagined a footpath running along the eastern mountains, from New England to the southern Appalachians. In 1921 Benton MacKaye proposed building a system of trails along the ridges of the Appalachian Mountains. His dream eventually became what is today's Appalachian Trail” A trail that stretches for some 2,190 miles between Maine and Georgia.”  http://bmtguide.com , Step by Step (An Introduction to Walking the Appalachian Trail, By the staff of the Appalachian Trail Conservancy)I will begin my adventure in 33 days. I find I'm so excited, I can barely sit still or hold a thought in my head.

Hello everyone,
Only two weeks till the adventure begins. Can't hardly wait. Been packing and re-packing my backpack. Trying to get the weight down. It's 10 pounds base weight (pack, sleeping bag, and tent). Not too bad. 13 pounds without food or water, so it's not too heavy. 
Been hiking a bit. The beach is beautiful this time of year. Should be around 85 today. Nice. 
Can't wait to meet other hikers and make new friends along the A.T.
Cake

Hello everyone,My husband, Jeff, and I have made it to Hapers Ferry. We toured the city and of course The Appalachian Trail Conservancy. Everyone there was very helpful and had a lot of great advice.I start hiking tomorrow. I can't sit still or keep a single thought in my head.
